meanings.sent1: She respelt the word to make sure it was correct.
meanings.sent2: He respelt the name using a different alphabet.
meanings.sent3: The cat respelt its name as 'Meow' on the registration form.
meanings.sent4: The artist respelt reality through the lens of their imagination.
meanings.sent5: The teacher respelt the difficult word to help the students understand.

meanings.definition: Past tense and past participle of respell.
meanings.sent1: She respelt the word yesterday during the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: He respelt the name incorrectly in the previous round.
meanings.sent3: The chef respelt the recipe but ended up with a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The memories respelt themselves in his mind like a vivid dream.
meanings.sent5: The magic of the moment respelt itself in her heart, forever cherished.
